text:
ROBBYN SWAN: Around
9:30, 9:25, Matthew
Oldfield was going upstairs.
He said to Kate, I'll take it.
I'll go and check on your three.

He went into the
McCann's apartment,

he went to the door of
the children's bedroom
but he didn't not go in.

CLARENCE MITCHELL: He looked
in, he saw the twins who
were in cots through the door.

But he didn't put his
head round to the left

where he would have seen if
Madeleine was there or not.

And I'm sure it's something
he regrets massively.

REPORTER: Less than 30 minutes
later it was Kate McCann's turn

KATE MCCANN: I went back
to do a check at 10:00.

And I went through the
patio doors at the back.

Just noticed that the door
to the children's bedroom
was quite far open.

And just as I was
about to close it,

it kind of slammed as if a
gust of wind had shut it.

CLARENCE MITCHELL: Her heart
sank then, at that point
because that was all wrong.
Everything was wrong.

KATE MCCANN: Then I
went back just to open
the door again a little bit.

Just as I did that, I noticed
that the shutter was open,
the window was open.

ROBBYN SWAN: And then she saw
that Madeleine's bed was empty.

INTERVIEWER: And what did
you think in that moment?

KATE MCCANN: I thought
someone's taken her.
[tense music]
[no speech]
